hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Umayr (the slave): I attended with my masters at Khaybar, and the Messenger of Allah ﷺ commanded me, so I girded myself with a sword. Then behold, I was dragging it, and I informed him that I was a slave. So he commanded for me something from the spoils of war.

Treatment of slaves by their masters
Event at the conquest of Khaybar

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Umayr (the slave): My master would give me something to eat from his food, so I would eat it. Then he would prevent me or beat me. Then I asked the Messenger of Allah ﷺ or asked him, saying: I will not stop and I will not leave it. So the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: The reward is between you both.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Umayr (the slave): My master commanded me to cut meat for him. A poor person came, so I fed him. My master became aware of me, so he beat me. Then I came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and informed him. He said: Why did you beat him? He said: Because he eats from my food without my permission. So he said: The reward is between you both.

hadiths.english_translation: Chapter: Mentioning of Sabra ibn Abi Fakihah (may Allah be pleased with him)

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

Topics: Chapter heading about Sabra ibn Abi Fakihah

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Sabra ibn Abi Fakihah (may Allah be pleased with him) who was from the Companions of the Prophet ﷺ: Satan sat for the son of Adam at his paths. He sat for him at the path of Islam, saying to him: Will you accept Islam and leave your religion and the religion of your fathers? Then he sat for him at the path of migration, saying: Will you migrate and leave your birthplace so you become like a horse in his length? Then he sat for him at the path of struggle (Jihad), saying: Will you struggle and be killed? Then your wife will marry and your wealth will be divided. So the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Whoever did that, Allah Mighty and Majestic guaranteed him Paradise.
